name: BEST WESTERN Plus Evergreen Inn & Suites

reviews.text: This is an aged property that asks top dollar due to the proximity to Weyhauser Pool. Not worth the price. If you can get at room at the Courtyard across the street, do it! Nothing at the BW Evergreen has been updated, the TV's are huge boxes, the fixtures in the bathrooms are worn and the gym is small, stuffy and makes working out painful. Most frustrating however is the inaccurate claim that wireless is available. It only works in the lobby. Either update your wireless or present access accurately. On the positive side, the room was clean. But then, it should be that shouldn't be a perk.
reviews.title: Wireless internet non existent in rooms

reviews.text: Staying here is one HUGE nightmare. I feel bad for Tisha, Shayla, Laura, and Chris who have to constantly explain why the internet and TV's are not working. The elevator didnt work at one point for almost two months, how is that possoble? They have great customer service skills, but how are they to really do a SUPERIOR job when nothing in the hotel is working properly? I dont know about you but management really needs to take a step back and see that their hotel is falling apart. I constantly see new employees...why is that? Hope this is an eye opener to future guests staying here, its too bad really...
reviews.title: Terrible...Terrible...Terrible...

reviews.text: I have stayed at numerous BW's from Seattle to San Diego and never been in a nicer location. These folks have really raised the bar for my expectations at BW locations. Staff was pleasant, professional, friendly, efficient. Lobby was spotless and nicely decorated. My suite was exceptional.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!!!

reviews.text: My family and I have stayed at this hotel over the past several years during our frequent (2+ times per year) trips to Puget Sound to visit family and friends. It is the only hotel in the area with reasonably priced 2 bedroom suites with enough beds and room for a 5 person family with teenagers.
reviews.title: Not the Hotel it used to be....

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and well maintained. The breakfast is very nice, with a broad selection of items available.
reviews.title: It's a hotel room

reviews.text: We had a 2 bedroom suite with fireplace. The suite was spacious and clean. Stayed on the side away from the freeway, so noise was not an issue. The fireplace did not work for half the stay. The elevator not working properly was only a minor inconvenience. Breakfast was adequate, although we were told the eggs were not real eggs. The stay was inexpensive, clean, comfortable, and convenient.
reviews.title: Good location, comfortable suite

reviews.text: The location is great, but the elevator has been broken for over a month according to operator. They had to manually run the elevator. Good if you were on going up, but terrible if you needed service down. We waited for over 10 min to get someone to come get us, we couldn't use stairs with luggage. We stayed in 2 room suite which was great except the lg bedroom was so hot and lowering the thermostat didn't help. We ended up opening the window in the middle of Jan. The other bedroom and the living area were freezing.
reviews.title: elevator broken and temperature guage off in room

reviews.text: We stayed at this location from December 23-January 2nd. The elevator was not working the whole time we were there. The staff that had to bring us up to our floor was always nice. One day we went there and like they started cleaning our room then stopped. We had to ask for more towels and toilet paper. The next day we left kind of late and again didn't get our room cleaned while we were out that day. So had to ask for more towels. Then I called the front desk to ask what time do we have to be out by to get our room cleaned? They said well they are cleaning rooms all day. I ask well what time do they leave? They said they leave at 1:30.(I wanted to say till 1:30 is not all day!) So the next day we made sure we left earlier. Would be nice if they can let the hotel guest know what time we need to leave to get our room cleaned the following day. I was worried about how New Years Eve would be staying there. Wondering if it would be loud but it was nice and quiet which was nice. Wish they had the breakfast downstairs quit at a later time. The area where you can use the computer needs improving. One computer worked but not the printer. And the other computer didn't but the printer worked. Other then that the hotel stay was alright.
reviews.title: Hotel stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I (and our Black Lab) stayed in this hotel one night in a one-bedroom suite. It was great, since one of us likes to wind down with the TV, while the other likes to read in bed. The king bed was very comfortable, the buffet breakfast had lots of choices. The staff was friendly and helpful. As another reviewer mentioned, the elevator was operated by a staff member, since maintenance was required - it was like being back in time, when all elevators had an operator. Convenient acess to I-5 and the airport.
reviews.title: How suite!

reviews.text: The hotel was located near the confluence of 3 highways between Seattle and Tacoma. The rooms were adequately spacious, the staff was responsive, the lobby had seating areas with tables for business meetings, and in addition to free breakfast, the hotel has a restaurant on site.
reviews.title: Nice amenities, convenient location

reviews.text: The Internet connection was a bit slow, so for a business trip, that caused a bit of difficulty. However, overall, I would recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Thank you for the GREAT STAY

reviews.text: Hotel stay was going to need to be extended by 1 day, no problem for the staff, they helped right away, securing us another night. Hotel drivers were great, transporting us back and forth to hospital!
reviews.title: One of the worst I've visited

reviews.text: The room being divided into separate smaller rooms was a god-send. Teenage girls appreciated their privacy. Being.located right of the freeway around 20 minutes from sea-tacairport was also a plus. Way to go.
reviews.title: thanks

reviews.text: I reserved my room online for one night and paid for it ahead of time. When I checked in, they needed my credit card for "incidentals". Beginning the day after I checked out, I had several "Pending" charges on my card, that would drop off after a few days. I contacted the Best Western in Federal Way and the only response was "we don't have your card on file, so it can't be us" and they gave me the extension for their accountant, who did not return my call. About a week after my stay, I stopped receiving the "Pending" charges; however, I received one very large charge for more than $600. I contacted Best Western in Federal Way again and received the same response they gave me before. I told the person at the desk who answered that the accountant did not return my call and asked for a manager or supervisor. He did not know who his supervisor/manager was. I asked him who I could call above him to get this resolved; he told me to call the 1-800 number for best western and that is the corporate office. I then contacted corporate Best Western and was told that I would receive a refund within 7 days, but have yet to receive one. This whole issue has been ongoing for three weeks now. I finally had to contact my bank and start the dispute process. In the meantime, I still have the charge against my credit card. I am beyond frustrated and will NOT stay at another Best Western hotel again.
reviews.title: Unauthorized charges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was okay but the service was excellent! The elevator was broken at the time of myself and my husbands staycation but the man (Martine) who ran the elevator was so pleasant and accommodating he mad the idea of it being broken a joy! Almost like an Ole school elevator handler but with panache!! Thanks to you Martine, i didnt complain about the elevator or taking the stairs on occasion ( my choice completely).
reviews.title: Martine

reviews.text: My family has been spending the Holidays at this property for years. The pool, restaurant and the proximity to the mall for shopping has been our standard for years. We will not be going back! The entire property is filthy. The pool is no longer maintained. The dishes in the restaurant to the sheets on the bed were as disgusting as I've seen anywhere. We had several rooms and all smelled like wet dog. When I tried to address it with management they had excuses but no resolutions. I don't know if there was a change in ownership or management but we won't be going back.
reviews.title: End of an Era
